sn12.52:1.2: “There are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, your craving grows.
sn12.52:1.3: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn12.52:1.4: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
sn12.52:1.5: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn12.52:1.6: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
sn12.52:1.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.52:2.1: Suppose a bonfire was burning with ten, twenty, thirty, or forty loads of wood.
sn12.52:2.2: And from time to time someone would toss in dry grass, cow dung, or wood.
sn12.52:2.3: Fueled and sustained by that, the bonfire would burn for a long time.
sn12.52:2.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, your craving grows.
sn12.52:2.5: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.52:2.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.52:3.1: There are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, your craving ceases.
sn12.52:3.3: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
sn12.52:3.4: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn12.52:3.5: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn12.52:3.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.52:4.1: Suppose a bonfire was burning with ten, twenty, thirty, or forty loads of wood.
sn12.52:4.2: And no-one would toss in dry grass, cow dung, or wood from time to time.
sn12.52:4.3: As the original fuel is used up and no more is added, the bonfire would be extinguished due to lack of fuel.
sn12.52:4.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, your craving ceases.
sn12.52:4.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
